__e: People come to me who are close to being driven mad by remorse and guilt.
DNA proves his car ran her down, but I don't think he killed her.
I am the woman you know, only now, brimming with remorse and fear.
I never once regretted any of it, because I joined up to safeguard the city I love.
Well, feeling remorse about being wrong isn't as good as just doing something right, but it's a start.
Yeah. I know you're gonna work up a shitload of guilt over this. but not me.
Don't feel regretful or guilty about the past, or worry about the future.
If he'd shown any regret or respect, I wouldn't have fetched the gun.
Is it better to go to bed and have a regret... or just leave and have a regret for life?
Why would you have remorse about moving back to the city?
I've been given a second chance at life, and I don't want to live with the regret of not doing things I was meant to do just 'cause I'm too scared or I don't remember how.
Don't go, Colonel. I don't want to regret his death forever.
